sen.j: 平 善棟（たいら の よしむね/善棟王（よしむねおう）、生年未詳 - 天長6年6月22日 (旧暦)（829年7月26日））は平安時代前期の賜姓皇族。
sen.e: TAIRA no Yoshimune (Imperial prince Yoshimune without permission for claiming the prince) (Date of birth unknown - July 30, 829) was a shisei kozoku (member of the Imperial Family conferred with a family name) in the early Heian period.
TAIRA no Yoshimune (Imperial Prince Yoshimune) (Date of birth unknown - July 30, 829) was a member of the Imperial family in the early Heian period who became a subject of the state.
TAIRA no Yoshimune (Prince Yoshimune) (year of birth unknown - July 30, 829) was a member of the Imperial family in the early Heian period who became a subject of the state.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の皇孫で葛原親王の第二王子。
sen.e: He was an imperial descendant of Emperor Kanmu and the second prince of Imperial Prince Kazurawara.
He was an imperial descendant of Emperor Kanmu and the second son of Imperial Prince Kazurawara.

sen.j: 兄弟に平高棟、高見王らがある。
sen.e: His brothers included TAIRA no Takamune and Prince Takami.

sen.j: 天長2年（825年）、従四位下に叙爵。
sen.e: In 825, he was awarded the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 同年、兄の高棟らとともに平氏姓を賜り臣籍降下したことが『類聚国史』に見える。
sen.e: "Ruijin Kobushi" states that he and others including his brother Takamune received the family name of Taira, becoming subjects of the state in the same year.

The "Ruiju Kobushi", a ninth century historical text, states that he and his brother Takamune were among several people who received the family name Taira on becoming subjects of the state in the same year.
